meanings.definition: To put a new tread on a worn tire.
meanings.sent1: After driving many miles, the mechanic recapped the tire to make it safe again.
meanings.sent2: The tire shop recapped my old tire, making it look like new.
meanings.sent3: The tire was so worn out that it begged to be recapped for a fresh start.
meanings.sent4: She recapped the tire, giving it a second chance to hit the road.
meanings.sent5: Recapping the tire transformed it from old to reliable in no time.

meanings.definition: To summarize or review the main points of something.
meanings.sent1: Before the test, she recapped the important information to help her remember.
meanings.sent2: The teacher recapped the lesson to ensure everyone understood.
meanings.sent3: Recapping the story made it easier to understand the plot twists.
meanings.sent4: He recapped the meeting, highlighting the key decisions made.
meanings.sent5: Recapping the main points helped him study effectively for the exam.

meanings.definition: To replace the cap on something.
meanings.sent1: She recapped the bottle to keep the drink fresh.
meanings.sent2: After pouring a glass, she recapped the wine bottle.
meanings.sent3: Recapping the pen prevented it from drying out.
meanings.sent4: He recapped the marker to preserve its ink.
meanings.sent5: Recapping the bottle kept the contents from spilling.
